alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Mobile Inland (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 17 at 3:06PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Mobile, northwestern Baldwin, southeastern Washington and southern Clarke Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 306 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Calvert, or 14 miles northeast of Citronelle, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mount Vernon and Calvert. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
